document.docAuthor: Silva, Roberta Dos Santos Da, Cavichioli, Rodney R., Takiya, Daniela M. & Mejdalani, Gabriel
document.docTitle: Acrogonia dentata Silva & Cavichioli & Takiya & Mejdalani 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions of seven new Acrogonia species from South America (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellinae: Proconiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions of seven new Acrogonia species from South America (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellinae: Proconiini)

subSubSection.paragraph: Total length. Male holotype 9.8 mm ; male paratypes 9.2–10.5 mm (n = 11); female paratypes 10.2–10.5 mm (n = 3).

Holotype description
. Head and thorax. Structural features of head and thorax much as described above for
A. falcata
sp. nov.
, except pronotal disc without rugae, posterior margin of pronotum strongly concave, and forewings translucent.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 33–40.
Acrogonia dentata
sp. nov.
33, body, male paratype (MNRJ), dorsal view (total length 9.6 mm); 34, body, male paratype, lateral view; 35–40, male genitalia: 35, pygofer, lateral view; 36, subgenital plates, ventral view (valve not depicted); 37, styles and connective, dorsal view; 38, aedeagus, lateral view; 39, aedeagus, ventral view; 40, anal tube (segment X only), lateral view. Scale bars: 35–37 = 1 mm; 38–40 = 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 41–51.
Acrogonia dentata
sp. nov.
, female genitalia: 41–42, sternite VII, ventral view (macerated and unmacerated specimen, respectively); 43, valvifer I and valvula I, lateral view; 44, valvifers I and valvulae I, ventral view; 45, dorsal sculptured area; 46, apical portion of dorsal sculptured area; 47, ventral sculptured area; 48, valvula II, lateral view (basidorsal portion not depicted); 49, teeth at median portion of blade; 50, teeth at apical portion of blade; 51, apex and preapical prominence. Scale bars: 41 = 1 mm; 43, 44, 48 = 0.5 mm. VID = ventral interlocking device; VLB = ventral lobe.

subSubSection.paragraph: Intraspecific variation. The disc of the pronotum may present green or yellow spots, or it may be more uniformly brown. The mesonotum may present only small yellow spots, or a transverse yellow area on scutellum, or a large yellow area on central portion of scutum and scutellum.

Etymology. The name of the new species,
dentata
, refers to the denticles of the aedeagal rami ( Figs. 38–39 ).
